properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued January 5 at 2:30AM PST until January 6 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...South to southwest winds 15 to 25 kt will diminish to
southwest to west 15 to 20 kt by Sunday afternoon. Seas will be
10 to 11 feet at 10 to 11 seconds initially, building to 12 to
14 feet at 12 seconds Sunday evening, then subsiding to 10 to 11
feet at 12 seconds Monday.

* WHERE...All areas will be affected by at least advisory
conditions. Hazardous seas will develop from the coast at Cape
Blanco to beyond 10 nm of the coast at Gold Beach, then beyond
30 nm of the coast from Gold Beach to Point St. George.

* WHEN...For the Hazardous Seas Warning, 10 AM PST this morning
until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Small Craft Advisory,
until 4 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Very steep and hazardous seas could capsize or
damage vessels. Bar crossing will become especially
treacherous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Recreational boaters should remain in port. Commercial vessels
should prepare for very steep seas and consider remaining in port
until conditions improve.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST MONDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING
